go_data.justification: The muscle-specific ubiquitin ligase MuRF1 has recently been shown to specifically inhibit PPARalpha, but not PPARbeta/delta or PPARgamma1, activity in vivo through mono-ubiquitination.
MuRF1 was found to inhibit PPARalpha in the cardiomyocyte through mono-ubiquitination that enhanced nuclear export without promoting PPARalpha degradation.
MuRF1 inhibits PPARalpha-regulated fatty acid oxidation by mono-ubiquitinating lysines adjacent to a newly identified nuclear export sequence in PPARalpha, implying nuclear localization.
MuRF1 inhibited PPARalpha-regulated fatty acid oxidation both in vitro and in vivo by mono-ubiquitination.

go_data.term: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II
go_data.justification: MuRF1 inhibits PPARalpha activity, which is a transcription factor, implying a role in regulating transcription.
